intro: Achillea vermiculata, commonly known as white yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features finely divided, gray-green leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry meadows and rocky areas. Its common name is derived from the Greek myth of Achilles, who supposedly used the plant to treat wounds.
